newsitem.title: USA: Marsh & McLennan unit buys Chicago firm.
newsitem.headline: Marsh & McLennan unit buys Chicago firm.

text.p: Seabury & Smith Inc, a unit of insurance broker Marsh & McLennan & Cos Inc, said Thursday it has acquired Chicago-based Albert H. Wohlers & Co.
Wohlers, a broker, consultant and administrator for professional associations and their members, had 1996 revenues of $30 million, Seabury & Smith said.
It did not disclose terms of the deal.

Seabury & Smith provides insurance program and underwriting management services in North America. It also is an underwriting manager of professional indemnity and directors' and officers' liability insurance in Britain.
Wohlers chairman Albert Wohlers said the combination was a "good fit."
Seabury and Smith president Claude Mercier said the deal "will strengthen our position as the preeminent program management firm in North America."
